cards.title: B3H3M-TH
cards.body: At the end of the environment turn, this card deals the non-environment target with the second lowest HP 4 fire damage.
cards.flavorText: Eventually the Cybersphere’s strongest{BR}defenses were corrupted by the virus.{BR}As the safeguards failed, the sleepers{BR}within the sphere began to awaken.

cards.title: DR3D-NT
cards.body: At the end of the environment turn, this card deals each other target 2 projectile damage.
cards.flavorText: The stranger opened his eyes within the{BR}artificial world. The first thing he saw{BR}was a ship, floating above the glowing{BR}buildings and aiming its cannons at him.

cards.title: FO55-1L
cards.body: At the end of the environment turn, this card deals the non-environment target with the second highest HP 3 melee damage and 1 lightning damage.
cards.flavorText: 'That simulation is linked to defense{BR}grids around the globe,' said Bunker.{BR}'We’ve got to get a team in there and{BR}stop Gray before it’s too late.'

cards.title: GHO-5T
body: At the end of the environment turn, each hero must destroy 1 of their ongoing or equipment cards.
When this card is destroyed, each player may draw a card.
cards.flavorText: Cricket spun around and flung a sonic{BR}blast at the tattered figure, as her{BR}staff began to crumble into fragments{BR}of code from its touch.

cards.title: Glitch
cards.body: When this card is destroyed, it deals the non-environment target with the second highest HP 5 lightning damage.
cards.flavorText: A stray blast of radiation tore through{BR}the corridor walls with an unnatural{BR}scream. The air flickered with light, and{BR}Gray’s arm lost its shape.

cards.title: H3L-1X
cards.body: At the start of the environment turn, this card deals the hero target with the lowest HP 1 melee damage, the hero target with the second highest HP 3 melee damage, and the hero target with the highest HP 5 melee damage.
cards.flavorText: There’s two kinds of viral constructs{BR}you can expect to run into; the ones you{BR}don’t want to mess with, and the ones{BR}you really don’t want to mess with.

cards.title: Holocycle Race
body: At the start of the environment turn, each player may discard up to 2 cards. Then, unless {H} cards were discarded this way, destroy this card.
cards.flavorText: Several game programs had been{BR}activated by the system. The holocycle{BR}race was particularly dangerous, as{BR}Tiamat had made its lair on the course.

cards.title: Hologame Arena
body: Whenever a hero card destroys an environment target, that hero draws a card.
At the end of the Environment turn, either destroy this card or play the top card of the Environment deck.
cards.flavorText: “Well,” said the Stranger, “I believe a{BR}little invisibility will even the playing{BR}field. Good hunting.” Next to him, Tango{BR}loaded her rifle and faded from sight.

cards.title: Infected Firewall
body: Reduce damage dealt to environment targets by 1.
At the end of the environment turn, play the top card of the environment deck.
cards.flavorText: The shapeshifter recoded his fists into{BR}armored battering rams and began{BR}hammering away at the barrier. Behind it,{BR}several new viruses emerged.

cards.title: Infected Holoweapon
body: At the end of the environment turn, this card deals the 2 non-environment targets with the highest HP 2 irreducible energy damage each.
Damage dealt by those targets is irreducible until the start of the environment turn.
cards.flavorText: “This is not my blade. Not even a{BR}simulation of it,” said Fanatic, as she{BR}examined the floating weapon. “This is an{BR}instrument of corruption.”

cards.title: N1N-J4
body: At the end of the environment turn, this card deals the target other than itself with the lowest HP 3 energy damage.
Whenever damage dealt by this card destroys a target, play the top card of the environment deck.
cards.flavorText: The first agents spread by the Virus{BR}were infiltrators programmed to{BR}overwrite unsecured files and turn{BR}them against the system.

cards.title: Replication
body: When this card enters play, play the top X cards of the environment deck, where X is 1 plus the number of Grid Virus cards currently in play.
At the end of the environment turn, destroy this card.
cards.flavorText: As Cypher prepared to engage the{BR}cranial jack, warning lights began to{BR}flash on the console. The virus was{BR}spreading out of control.

cards.title: SP4-RK
cards.body: At the end of the environment turn, this card deals the non-environment target with the second highest HP 3 toxic damage.
cards.flavorText: In its simplest form the virus appeared{BR}as an amalgamation of random shapes,{BR}floating through the cybersphere and{BR}searching for other entities to infect.

cards.title: System Crash
cards.body: At the start of the environment turn, if there are at least 4 Grid Virus cards in play, everyone is deleted. [b]Game Over.[/b]
cards.flavorText: “The cybersphere was created as a{BR}pacification mechanism,” said the warden.{BR}“somehow the subjects have corrupted{BR}the source code from inside.”

cards.title: Your Mind Makes it Real
body: When this card enters play, it deals each target 3 lightning damage.
At the end of the environment turn, destroy this card.
cards.flavorText: The Raptor bot exploded into flames{BR}which felt uncannily real. “If only your{BR}arm had some sort of giant blaster{BR}for situations like this!” yelled Unity.
